definition: words and actions/what one says and what one does

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
(idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says
(idiom) to say one thing and do another
(idiom) to say one thing and do another
(idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says

sentences.english: People around her with his own words and deeds education to protect the environment, take good care of public property.
sentences.chinese: 她用自己的言行教育身边的人保护环境，爱护公物。

sentences.english: In itself it would not embody anything unclear or contradictory.
sentences.chinese: 理想自身不会包含任何不清不楚或言行一致的东西。

sentences.english: The discrepancy means poor countries will end up bearing most of the burden themselves.
sentences.chinese: 这种言行不一意味着最终穷国将自己担起大部分重担。

sentences.english: If with a pure mind a person speaks or acts, happiness follows him like his never-departing shadow.
sentences.chinese: 若人以清净之心言行，快乐将跟随着他，如影随形。

sentences.english: In office, he kept his word.
sentences.chinese: 在办公室里，他言行一致。

sentences.english: Their frail deeds might have danced in a green bay.
sentences.chinese: 他们翩舞于绿色海湾的脆弱言行。

sentences.english: If you don’t get your act together, will you ever get what you want?
sentences.chinese: 如果你言行不一致的话，你能够实现你的愿望吗？

sentences.english: Maybe you, too, have observed people who call themselves Christians and then don't show it.
sentences.chinese: 你可能也注意到一些自称基督徒却又言行不符的人。

sentences.english: Despite the rhetorical force of her convictions, some Tory colleagues accuse her of inconsistency.
sentences.chinese: 尽管宣称一以贯之，有些保守党指责她言行不一。

sentences.english: No man could suffer his vulgarities.
sentences.chinese: 谁也无法容忍他的粗野言行。

sentences.english: His words don't agree with his action.
sentences.chinese: 他的所作所为与他的言行不一致。
他总是不断反省是否言行合理。

sentences.english: For companies and individuals as much as for governments, deeds will henceforward have to match words.
sentences.chinese: 不论对企业，个人还是政府，从今以后都得言行一致。
神是言行一致的，不变的神。

sentences.english: I am not bound to succeed, but I am bound to live up to the light I have.
sentences.chinese: 我不一定求成功，但定必言行如一，贯彻始终。

sentences.english: All he said and did was remarkable in her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他的一切言行在她眼里都是了不起的。

definition: variant of 言辭|言辞[yan2 ci2]
to train/to educate/to bring up/to nurture/education/culture/upbringing/early conditioning
(idiom) to say one thing and do another
